Name: Sarcophagus of a cat
Description: From the Late Period onwards the mummies of cats were often laid out in sarcophagi of wood or bronze. They were slipped in by an opening in the base of the sarcophagus, sculpted with the image of a living feline. The Brussels example shows a cat whose eyes were inlaid and whose ears, each pierced by two holes, probably carried rings of gold (?). Cat sarcophagi have been found in the numerous necropoleis of sacred animals.
